column8: Responsible for research, analysis and policy development to meet demand for long range employment capacity across all commercial land use types on the City of Portland.

I work in growth management planning a the central Puget Sound's metropolitan planning organization where I work with cities on addressing regional policy objectives in local planning.  I am also lead staff on our regional centers program, which identifies both mixed-use areas designated for future growth, as well as manufacturing/industrial centers.

column8: My job is to help ascertain where are city is going, where we want to go, and how to bridge the two, from a land use lens. Currently this entails figuring out how to accommodate growth while leveraging it to create public benefits, all while maintaining what is already great about our city.

As a senior planner in the Planning and Urban Design Department, I work on the Design Studio team. Some of our work includes direct design, which involves working with both private developers as well as various city departments such as Streets, Parks, and Public Works to improve their projects. We also conduct urban design peer review and work with various agencies on large infrastructure projects that affect the city.

column7: Assistant Executive Director - Redevelopment Authority of the City of Milwaukee
column8: The mission of the Redevelopment Authority is to eliminate blighting conditions that inhibit neighborhood reinvestment, to foster and promote business expansion and job creation, and to facilitate new business and housing development. Toward that end, the Redevelopment Authority prepares and implements comprehensive redevelopment plans, assembles real estate for redevelopment, is empowered to borrow money, issue bonds and make loans, and can condemn property (eminent domain) in furtherance of redevelopment objectives.

Airpot supporting industrial uses are present.  Other uses include food distribution, auto salvage & scrap metal.
